column4: how do i uninstall an older version of an application (package) on my PC
There are a few ways, are you using Terminal, Synaptic Package manger or something like that?
with synaptic, it shows me only the version of the package that i got from a repository
however, i installed more recent versions via dpkg
so i don't think synaptic can help on this
Here is the Debian page on that: http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/doc/debian/ch-dpkg.html
And yes, the GUIs may leave crud behind, CLI with dpkg is one of the surest ways.
i fear that using the -r switch will remove all versions of the app
are you aware if this is the case?
I've got three versions.. and i actually wanna remove just one - the oldest
No, read section 16.5, but also I always make a backup , just in case.
terBotL Often times it is cleaner to remove/purge all, then install/fetch the one that you wish, keeps the kernel cleaner also.
Ever tried BleachBit, Sweeper or Computer Janitor?

thanks... i'm in the middle of development.. and its a netbeans IDE that i'm trying to uninstall.. can't take chances now.. cos it might cost me some time.. to set everything back up.. will try later then
not yet. . will have a look

I know Computer Janitor is a pretty hefty and clean GUI pkg cleaner/maintainer, is installed on a default system, give that a run, or go Synaptic and find Old/Broken, that is ine Sections area, bottom Left.
